member.name: T:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser
member.summary: Performs the actual parsing of a command line and provides methods for retrieving descriptive information about the options and groups available.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The option manager.

remarks.para: The option manager is the user defined object that is tagged with the various attributes available in this namespace that contains definitions of the available options.
This constructor initializes the parser with the specified in of . This may not be desired, since it affects the parsing of numbers by this parser.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.#ctor(System.Object,System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The option manager.
An object describing how numerical arguments should be parsed.

remarks.para: The option manager is the user defined object that is tagged with the various attributes available in this namespace that contains definitions of the available options.
This constructor initializes the parser with the specified, which affects the way that numbers are parsed.
By default the assignment characters available are the equal sign ('=') for all options and the colon (':') for windows style options. See for information on how to change this.
The default escape character is the backslash ('\'). See for information on how to change this.
The default quotation enabled is by using double quotes ('"') within which the backslash ('\') character and the double quote ('"') can be escaped.
In unquoted values the space character and the backslash can be escaped.

member.exception: or was a null reference
an error in the configuration of the option manager was found.
Indicates an internal error and should normally never be thrown.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.Parse
member.summary: Performs the actual parsing of the command line, setting (or calling) the relevant members of the option manager.

remarks.para: The command line from will be used for parsing, assuming that the first argument is the path to the executable of this application.

After parsing has been completed the property and property should be examined to determine if the command line was correct or not. If there are errors, the state of the option manager object (i.e. which properties has been set or not) is undefined.

member.summary: Performs the actual parsing of a command line, setting (or calling) the relevant members of the option manager.
member.param: A string containing the command line passed to be parsed.
if set to true it is assumed that the first argument on the command line is the path to the executable used to run this program.
member.remarks: After parsing has been completed the property and property should be examined to determine if the command line was correct or not. If there are errors, the state of the option manager object (i.e. which properties has been set or not) is undefined.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.SetEscapeCharacters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Char})
member.summary: Sets the escape characters recognized by this parser for escaping characters.
member.param: The escape characters that should be recognized.
member.remarks: The only escape character set by default is the backslash ('\') character which is pretty much standard for escaping characters. But should so be desired, other characters can be set here. No sanity checking of this argument is performed though, so be careful which characters you chose.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.AddQuotation(Plossum.CommandLine.QuotationInfo)
member.summary: Adds the specified quotation as a recognized quotation by this parser.
member.param: The quotation info.

remarks.para: By default only the double quote is recognized as a quotation character, within which the double quote itself and the backslash character can be escaped. In unquoted values the space character and the backslash can be escaped.
To specify quotations for unquoted strings, specify a with its quotation mark set to the null character ('\0').

member.name: T:Plossum.CommandLine.BoolFunction
member.summary: Specifies how a boolean command line option should be evaluated.
member.remarks: This enumeration applies to the property, and is ignored unless the attribute is applied to an attribute with the base type of bool. Options that are boolean values can be treated in different ways according to the values of this enumeration.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.BoolFunction.Value
member.summary: The option is set to the value specified, which means that the option requires a value (unless a default value is assigned, see ). The value must be specified as either or .

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.BoolFunction.TrueIfPresent
member.summary: The option does not accept a value, and if present on the command line the member to which the attribute is applied will be set to true.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.BoolFunction.FalseIfPresent
member.summary: The option does not accept a value, and if present on the command line the member to which the attribute is applied will be set to false.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.BoolFunction.UsePrefix
member.summary: The option does not accept a value. Instead if present on the command line the member to which the attribute is applied will be set to true if the prefix of the option was '+', otherwise; false. It is an error to use this enumeration if was not specified.

member.name: T:Plossum.WordWrappingMethod
member.summary: Represents the word wrapping method to use for various operations performed by .

member.name: F:Plossum.WordWrappingMethod.Greedy
member.summary: Uses a greedy algorithm for performing the word wrapping, that puts as many words on a line as possible, then moving on to the next line to do the same until there are no more words left to place.
member.remarks: This is the fastest method, but will often create a less esthetically pleasing result than the method.

member.name: F:Plossum.WordWrappingMethod.Optimal
member.summary: Uses an algorithm attempting to create an optimal solution of breaking the lines, where the optimal solution is the one where the remaining space on the end of each line is as small as possible.
member.remarks: This method creates esthetically more pleasing results than those created by the method, but it does so at a significantly slower speed. This method will work fine for wrapping shorter strings for console output, but should probably not be used for a real time WYSIWYG word processor or something similar.

member.name: T:Plossum.StringFormatter.OptimalWordWrappedString
member.summary: Class performing an "optimal solution" word wrapping creating a somewhat more estetically pleasing layout.

remarks.para: This is based on the "optimal solution" as described on the Wikipedia page for "Word Wrap" (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Word_wrap). The drawback of this method compared to the simple "greedy" technique is that this is much, much slower. However for short strings to print as console messages this will not be a problem, but using it in a WYSIWYG word processor is probably not a very good idea.

member.name: T:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles
member.summary: Flags indicating the option styles recognized by the .
member.remarks: Option styles indicates how options may be specified on the command line, for an example the style dictate that options are prefixed by a slash '/' while the style is prefixed by a double dash ('--'). Options may be freely combined using the binary or (|) operator. Note that both and implies the option style. You should never use binary operators to prevent this implication.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.None
member.summary: No options are enabled nor will be parsed. Everything on the command line is treated as remaining arguments (see ).

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.Windows
member.summary: The windows style for options is recognized. This means that options are prefixed with the slash '/' character. An option specified in this style will never be grouped (see ).

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.LongUnix
member.summary: The long unix style for options is recognized. This means that options with long names (more than one character) are prefixed with two dashes '--'. (Also options of only one character in length can be specified in this style). Options specified in this style will never be grouped (see ).

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.File
member.summary: Option files are recognized and parsed automatically by the . This allows specifying a file name prefixed by the '@' character on the command line. Any such file will then be opened and parsed for additional command line options by the command line parser. The syntax for the options (or additional arguments) specified in the file is the very same as that for the command line itself).

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.ShortUnix
member.summary: The short unix style for options is recognized. This means that options are prefixed by a single dash ('-'). If is also specified, any options specified in this style will be grouped.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.Plus
member.summary: The plus style for options is recognized. Specifying this style implies the style. This means that options can be prefixed with either the dash ('-') character or the ('+') character. This can be useful for boolean options when used with the option, in which case the prefix of the option will indicate what value to set the option to. Options specified in this style will be grouped if the option is also specified.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.Group
member.summary: Grouping of options is enabled for the and style. Specifying this style also implies the style. Grouping of options means that several options with names only one character long can be concatenated on the command line. For an example the command line "tar -xvzf file.tar.gz" would be interpreted as "tar -x -v -z -f file.tar.gz". If this option is specified and option styles with names longer than one character should also be recognized the option style should also be enabled.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.Unix
member.summary: This option style indicates a combination of the and flags.

member.name: F:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles.All
member.summary: This means all option styles above are enabled.

member.name: T:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute
member.summary: Attribute indicating that the field to which is applied should receive the value of a command line option, and also specifies the properties of that option.
member.remarks: This attribute may be applied to properties, fields and methods. If applied to a method, the method must accept exactly one argument which may not be an array or collection type. The method will then be called once every time the option is specified with the value of the option. If specified on a field or property the type of that member must be one of the built-in types, a one-dimensional array of one of the built in types, a or a . If an array type or a collection type, the enumerable will contain all values that the option is specified with (if specified multiple times).

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.GroupId
member.summary: Gets or sets the group to which this option belongs.
member.value: The id of the group to which this option belongs, or null if this option does not belong to any group.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.Prohibits
member.summary: Gets or sets the names of other options that must not be specified on the command line if this option is specified.
member.value: The names of other options that must not be specified on the command line if this option is specified.
member.remarks: Option names can be comma- or space-separated. If an option prohibits another option, this automatically means that the other option also prohibits the first option, and it need not be explicitly specified.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this option.
member.value: The name of this option.
member.remarks: This is the text that the user will specify on the command line. If not explicitly set, this will take on the name of the member to which the attribute was applied.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.BoolFunction
member.summary: Gets or sets how option values will be assigned if this option is applied to a field of type bool.
member.value: The bool function of this option.
member.remarks: This value is ignored for any other member types than Boolean. See for more information.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.MaxOccurs
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times this option may be specified on the command line.
member.value: The the maximum number of times this option may be specified on the command line.

remarks.para: The default value for this option is 1 for any non-collection or array type, and 0 otherwise.
If this value is set to zero that means that there is no upper bound on the number of times this option may be specified.
remarks.note: Note that this value must be either 0 or 1 if the member is not a method, or if the field or property does not represent an array or collection type.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.MinOccurs
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of times this option may be specified on the command line.
member.value: The the minimum number of times this option may be specified on the command line.

remarks.para: The default value for this option is 0.
remarks.note: This value must be less than or equal to , unless is equal to 0.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description.
member.value: The description.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.DefaultAssignmentValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the default assignment value for this option.
member.value: The default assignment value for this option, or null if this option does not have a default assignment value.
member.remarks: This value must be null unless is set to true. If set, this means that if the option is specified without an explicit assignment, this is the value the option will be take. However if the option is never specified on the command line, this value will not be assigned to the associated member.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.RequireExplicitAssignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this option requires an explicit assignment character or not.
member.value: true if this option requires an explicit assignment character; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Requiring an explicit assignment character means that a valid assignment character must follow the option name on the command line to assign a value to this option. If this value is not set to true the assignment character between an option name and its intended value may be omitted.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.Aliases
member.summary: Gets or sets the aliases of this option.
member.value: A comma- or space-separated list of the aliases for this option.
member.remarks: An option may have one or more aliases, which are other names with which to refer to the same option. This is common in the UN*X world, where many programs provide both a long and a short name for most options.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.MaxValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for a numeric option.
member.value: The maximum value for a numeric option.
member.remarks: This option should be null for any non-numeric option. This option also defaults to null for non-numeric options, or the maximum value for the type of this option for numerical options.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.MinValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for a numeric option.
member.value: The minimum value for a numeric option.
member.remarks: This option should be null for any non-numeric option. This option also defaults to null for non-numeric options, or the minimum value for the type of this option for numerical options.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.IsMaxOccursSet
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has its property explicitly set.
member.value: true if this instance has its property explicitly set.; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Plossum.CommandLine.CommandLineOptionAttribute.DoesRequireExplicitAssignment
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this option requires explicit assignment.
member.value: A value indicating whether this option requires explicit assignment. If this value is null that means that it should inherit this value from its group or ultimately the manager.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified option style is valid.

member.returns: true if the specified option style is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An option style is invalid if the flag is not enabled, but the or is. This normally doesn't occur if you only use the binary or to combine flags however, since the values of the group and plus options also include the short unix style.

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyleManager.GetPrefix(Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the switch character used to specify an option of the specified style on the command line.
member.param: The option style.
The name of the option.
member.returns: the switch character used to specify this option.

remarks.para: If includes several option styles, the switch for the most specific one representing a single option style prefix is returned. The switches for the corresponding styles are as follows (in order from most specific to least):

OptionStyle Prefix
All +
Plus +
Group -
ShortUnix -
File @
LongUnix --
Windows /
(Items in italics does not represent a single unique prefix)

member.name: M:Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyleManager.PrefixOptionForDescription(Plossum.CommandLine.OptionStyles,System.String)
member.summary: Prefixes the option name with the prefix(es) with which it should be used.
member.param: The option style.
Name of the option.
member.returns: A string representing the name of the option prefixed according to the enabled option styles specified.
member.remarks: This method always prefers prefixing options with unix style to windows style prefixes if both are enabled. If is enabled, the option will be prefixed with "[+|-]" to indicate that either prefix may be used.
